communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: ICE transgender detainee reporting refile
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Guidance documents, policy memos and communications (emails, letters, text messages, etc.) from Immigration and Customs Enforcement about the decision to "no longer proactively screen for, or record in ICE data systems, related information on aliens who self-identify as a sex other than their biological sex at birth". This includes excluding transgender and intersex people in ICE data systems and public detention statistic reports. This population may be referred to as detainees "who self-identify as a sex other than their biological sex at birth" in records. I am seeking records from Jan. 20, 2025, to now.

I additionally request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, processed by a representative of the news media/press and is made in the process of news gathering and not for commercial usage.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ileana Garnand
